content: They recently added a "refine" button, that, together with the save and compare option, takes up half of the screen and hides the search results. There doesn't seem to be an option to hide these screen-hijacks and it is immensely frustrating because they are REALLY in the way. It doesn't add any functionality, in fact, it reduces functionality. It is so bad it makes me avoid using the app altogether.

Although I love the convenience and functions of the app I am finding it increasingly annoying as it crashes on multiple items daily. And even the cute dog with the 'Oops something went wrong our end' message is really getting on my pip!!! But for that it would have got more stars from me, the frequency that it crashes out is just far too often. Just hope they fix the bugs soon.

Almost every time I open it it tells me support for this app will end soon, I follow the installation instructions and get the same message every time. It might be that they no longer support Galaxy Note 5 and aren't able to distinguish this in the messages that pop up but it is very annoying. Aside from that, I do love the convenience and prices with Amazon.

Ever since I updated the app, it freezes on a blank screen with the multicolored bar that shows it "thinking" and never loads to the appropriate screen. So I can't login, can't do anything. The search bar occasionally loads but after you hit go, it just goes to that white loading screen. I've rebooted device and have uninstalled and reinstalled the app. Never have I had this issue until now. I'm using Galaxy s8+ also did this on my s7

Works well to buy from Amazon but three times over the past week it appears to have made duplicate purchases a day after the first. This might be due to issues with signal when making orders but I've now been charged for multiple extra items I don't need and that I can no longer receive due to where they were shipped to. Something to look out for as this has only started happening in the last week.

When you click an Amazon link in another app like WhatsApp, there is no option for opening it with the Amazon app so you have to open it with a browser and log in again. Very frustrating. If a friend sends me a link and I open it, it opens in a browser. Often I don't bother opening links for this reason. This has been a problem for a while. You deserve to lose out on sales for not fixing it

I tried the free trial of prime to see if its something Id be interested using again and after a few days of waiting I was told my package was delayed and possibly lost. I was happy with the previous things I had ordered, they turned up on time and the quality of the items were great, but Its a great app and easy to find what im looking for just wish I could get them on time.

Great app and easy to use. I prefer using over browsing on my laptop. I downloaded it a little over a month ago and I haven't purchased anything, but to browse is very convenient. However, I've recently found something I'd like to buy, but there's no "Proceed to checkout" option. Unless there's somewhere I need to go in the app or I'm not doing something, I can't find the prompt even when I go to view the items in my cart and confirm they're what I wish to purchase. Maybe look into this so I can purchase my items? Otherwise great app!

Buggy POS app. Images of products aren't viewable 98% of the time in the app. Touch feedback is garbage. Have to tap several times to view things like descriptions or photos of a product (most of the time they come up as photo unavailable). Very frustrating, this app is just as bad as Amazon's customer service and makes primes cost seem even more ridiculous.

This update is noticeably slower than the last iteration. It also just notified me that something off my wishlist was purchased for me. So much for birthday surprises. And, because of very vague descriptions, I couldn't tell which notification to turn off to stop getting more like that, so I had to just kill all notifications. Not a great app.

The app installs itself without my permission. I prefer to use amazon on my chrome browser not the app, and I have continuously tried to modify my settings to only use the browser version. Whenever I check my email and try to track a package or open a link, the app AUTOMATICALLY opens the links despite me having uninstalled it multiple times! It is pissing me off. I'm not sure if Amazon struck a deal with LG or Android giving them control or how the app is run, but i'm over it. Any love I may have had for the app is completely gone. This is ridiculous.

It will load a page flawlessly. 10-15 seconds later, if that, "Opps. Something went wrong. Return to Amazon Home Page." Every. Freaking. Time... This NEVER happened until I was forced into updating my app. Amazon has lost out on nearly $200 from me, since this update (because I can't read item descriptions when I keep getting returned to the homepage), since I found it easier to stop at Walmart on the way home, instead of having to wait an extra day for shipping by waiting to use my computer, later.

Continually having trouble connecting to the site, app freezes and says the page isn't available, but if I run WiFi off and back on it will appear. Never had issues like this until recently upgrading to Google pixel 3 phone. Have checked all app permissions and continued sporadic results. In addition, Amazon has not responded to this issue. Horrible

This app used to be good (not great), but at some point in the passed few months they did away with the ability to go through the full list of reviewer's photos in a slideshow format. Now you can only see one at a time or find that specific review and view those few photos in a slideshow. Bring the slideshow view back and add swipe navigation. It's 2018 for crying out loud!!

Online shopping with this app gets around 80 percent. I am mostly satisfied with the shopping and services but not always. Why? Stock updates could be a lot better, if Amazon linked it with their third party sellers. For instance, I could wait forever for one item and it would never come back into stock. Why? When I contact the seller directly, they say they no longer sell the product. This makes the Amazon app frustrating to use and unreliable. Will I continue to use it? Yes!

While the App is great for finding specific items, it has got very awkward to use for browsing for ideas.  For example, just try finding the vacuum cleaners or the cordless phones section in the "Shop by Department" menu.  If you know the specific product you're after, there's no problem searching for it.  On the other hand, I do like the continuous product scrolling that I wish the main Amazon website had, especially when browsing clothes. The App also shows dispatch and delivery notifications, which is nice.

This app is solid for the most part. When it is working, which I'd say is about 85% of the time, it works as well as anyone could expect. That other 15% is insta-closing or not starting up at all. Which is incredibly frustrating. Sometimes I see a flash of the app main page. Other times tapping the app to open it results in absolutely nothing at all. When the app gets into these fits (which isnt all that often, but one time is too many) restarting my phone does nothing to remedy. Amazon website still works fine during this. As does Amazon video app. Its solely an issue with the shopping app it seems. This is incredibly annoying as I shouldn't have to resort to the desktop site because someone cant iron out the faults of an app that shouldn't have this kind of problem.

While it's less annoying than using amazon on desktop, it has way too many glitches. It's worse than tumblr and that's saying something. It crashes very often, takes a long time to load, will switch lists without reason, and will even duplicate a dozen or so items from one list and put it in a completely different one. I give it two stars instead of one because if amazon dealt with the glitches it would be pretty good.

The issue I have is that 90% of the time I can't even open the different color options or sizing, or just whatever. Many times the add to cart button won't do anything, or add to wishlist won't actually add it. Most times I can only use the app to browse products, and then I'll hop on the computer to add to cart or list once I pick what I want. This issue has been going on for a few months now, and just seems to be freezing up more.. I think it was a couple updates ago this started happening...

This app is as awful as it gets. It doesn't load properly, and when it does it can take minutes just to load one photo of an item. The sorting system is broken, leaving out options that fit my search criteria when I use a certain search filter. App crashes constantly and won't even let me press the back button without going to the home page at times. It's a nightmare trying to find the most basic things with this app.

Amazon is rubbish. There is no cancel order button, and order confirmation is so slow. Also the orders section doesn't show your orders unless you apply a filter, so I had no idea if my order went through. This led me to ordering twice and being billed and charged twice. Also their gift to a friend option is woeful. The recipient could not receive the gift I had bought due to amazon account region of the recipient. Total trash by Amazon.

Would be a great tool, enabling shopping from your mobile device, if it actually worked without glitches. The primary annoyance is the app failing to recognize your selection from the search results. When clicking on your choice, nothing occurs. It looks as though we will continue to use our laptops, if we don't choose the eBay app. Not our preference, but more convenient than logging in from our laptops...

The Amazon underground app was 500% better than this until it lost support. This app is crash happy, and it's hit or miss if it will let me use a tray to make my lists. I have a lot of lists for school, work, activities, holidays, etc. And I loved being able to easily use the tray and change between lists to add something to one then something else to another. This app is super buggy and I'm very disappointed

Advertise special deals get charged full price. Went onto my laptop afterwards. I ordered several discounted items but could see the total price was wrong and yet you can't see the individual discounted price charged for individual items. I chatted online with a customer service rep who claimed I'd decided to choose the undiscounted price for 2 items!!! I've actually decided not to use amazon again. You can often find things cheaper elsewhere.

Existing app on phone quit working. Went to Google Play to update app - the only option option was to Install Amazon Shopping. The install repeatedly fails despite following troubleshooting error code 910. Now there is no Amazon app on my phone. Loved it before. Something similar happened a few years ago...different phone. Hoping this is resolved quickly.

The app has a lot of bugs. When clicking on variations I see a message "beep-boop-beep", the variations don't load and I can't select another variation. When I click on different things and menu options sometimes nothing happens. I saw an ad with a 20% discount coupon, I clicked on the coupon but could not apply the discount. There are a lot of different bugs like this.

App has always been great. (Had it for numerous years) Recently it is really buggy. Wishlist doesn't always show on the bottom of app. Delivery tracking shows up a blank screen (I have to exit delivery tracking page and re enter to see this information correctly). The option menu (3 horizontal lines top left) when pressed brings the menu up on the screen about 2cm from the left edge of screen (doesn't look right). Not the best at the moment. But I freaking love Amazon so...

If you are familiar with shopping at Amazon then you pretty much already know how the app works when buying something. However, if you purchased something that Amazon itself will make the delivery (i.e. Prime or expedited 2 or 3 day delivery, or some other situation), this is where the app shines because when the item is "Out for Delivery", you will be presented as map showing the approx. Location of your package and a notation as to how many stops the driver has before your package and I'll be delivered. The "current location" of the driver is approximate (for their safety" but it's accurate enough so you can plan and 100% accurate when it's delivered. And when it's delivered you will see a photo showing exactly where it is. Those two things are an indicator to me that they have us, the consumer, in mind because it is us (for the most part) who really benefits.

Shows items that are not available for shipping to Canada and puts them in cart before finally letting you know they're not available when you're checking out. Also very deceitful about the final price of said items. You get hit with surprise shipping and import fees seemingly randomly, but once again only at checkout once you've spent all that time choosing your items. Extremely frustrating app. The old version was much better.

Horrible experience with Amazon and their third-party vendors. Multiple packages either never arrived or arrived with missing or damaged pieces. Customer service was slow and the app made it nearly impossible to communicate and resolve the issue. Won't be using this app, Amazon Prime or Amazon again. To make matter worse, they have blocked any attempts at me posting a review on their site. For faulty products that had only 5 star reviews. Buyer beware.

This is perhaps the most well-constructed, solid app that I absolutely refuse to use. For the last month I had it installed, every 2nd launch would greet me with a screen prompting me to sign up for Prime. Were it a marketing message, it would simply be annoying. However, someone chose to wrap their marketing in a cheap ploy to get users to accidentally sign up for Prime. The ad praises Prime's virtues, while implying that turning down the option is a poor choice. The options are presented using buttons that mesh with standard GUIs that users are accustomed to, with the yes option pre-highlighted. It would be all too easy to simply breeze by something that seems like another plain old marketing message, tap the first option, and not realise that one had signed up. Combined with the patronising wording of the ad, I am very much not inclined to allow this app on my phone. If I need something from Amazon, I'll be using the browser.

I was forced to update to this newer Amazon shopping app after getting a message on the old one saying it would no longer be supported or updated. This new one is terribly slow and glitches alot. The images on it for the products are blurry, like they were taken by a flip phone or a very bad photographer, which makes no sense because when I look at the same images in the old app they are crystal clear and perfect. Something is seriously wrong with this app, instead of an upgrade it feels like a down grade. I really hate it. Someone should fix it because it deters me from shopping. I keep going back to the old app to look up things, its sooo frustrating!

Good app, but it's got a tendency to crashed repeatedly. Between 2 and 5 seconds of opening the app. It says "oops sorry, something's gone wrong on our end" with a button to redirect you to the homepage. Once I press it, the app shows me the same thing once again within seconds. Please fix this. Great app otherwise.

I love Amazon Prime!! I almost dropped them one day because i ordered something on accident from 3rd party and like 1 minute afterwards, I cancelled it but the seller sent an email out about an hour later saying my item has been shipped !!!! Before I could even contact Amazon, Amazon sent me an email with the cancellation and my money returned to my account. love the perks and the service

this app is not the worse it could be, but it isn't the best. In the past, I could record reviews of products on my phone and upload, from my phone, my video review. With each update of this app, this became more of a challenge, but I managed work arounds (that I should have never had to do to begin with). With this latest app, it refuses to upload videos from my phone, though the option to upload a video via the app is "available". A rep responded to my email inquiry about this and said videos must be uploaded from a computer and be in specific formats, which did not include .mp4 (the standard format for smartphone videos). I'm close to giving this app one star, but it manages to barely still get the job done (i.e.: browsing and ordering).

Sometimes there's multiple listings for the same product but the descriptions are different. Can be very frustrating when you're looking for something very specific. Another suggestion would be to have the option of having anything made in the USA, or any country you desire, have like a flag emoji or symbol like "amazons choice" in or above the products name. Would save a lot of time looking through descriptions.

I've waited a month to review this app because I thought it would be updated to fix the errors that keep popping up. I can open the app and it shows me the home page, but whenever I tap on any item it loads the page and then immediately swaps to a cute dog with a CS3 error. Same thing happens if I do a Google search of an item and I tap on an amazon listing. Cute dog error. This started happening around the first week of November and now I'm leaving a review one month later and no fix. Would be zero stars because it's unusable.

I love Amazon as much as the next person but this app is simply inoperable. I don't know if anyone else has this problem but the app crashes EVERY 5 MINUTES. I can't scroll through any page without it lagging, freezing and crashing. Even worse is when it freezes and disables my phone from closing and restarting the app, all the buttons stop working. Please fix this.

I kinda hate this app. It's a severely downgraded experience from using the website. You can't easily manage lists, you can't search for other people's lists, you can't manage your subscribe and save. The app doesn't launch when you click an Amazon link someone sends you. It's basically only for for buying things that you're actively searching for and nothing else.

I've ordered from Amazon a LOT in the past few years. Have been 100% satisfied with my service until this year. I lost my forklift key, which I need for work. I ordered some from Amazon and paid up for the fastest shipping they had available. I spent more than twice what the product was worth and it didn't get to me for SIX DAYS. Since I was in such dire need for the item I had to just grit and bare it. But man did they let me down..

Shopping cart doesn't load properly. Initially shows me be a dozen items. If I wait long enough it might load 6 more, then 6 more, etc etc. Sometimes doesn't seem to be loading at all. A SHOPPING app that doesn't have a properly functioning shopping cart? Really, Amazon? I am so tired of Amazon's inability to create intuitive design minus functionality issues.

This is the worst, most nonfunctional app I have ever used. It just doesn't work. Pages don't load. Menus are unresponsive. Notifications for packages are several hours late. Its honestly really upsetting that a company with as much money as Amazon can't even make a halfway decent app. You're better off using the Amazon website in your mobile browser.

Avoid at all costs if you're in a non-English country. First time I tried to buy something, I opted to start a prime trial and they immediately locked my account. When I sent them a statement as verification, they couldn't verify because it wasn't in English. Yesterday, they charged the same credit card that they wouldn't verify with a prime subscription which I can neither use nor disable.

Delivery Sucks!! I was such a fan of Amazon and the app until my packages stopped being delivered. I honestly had no problem in the past, but I've had 3 packages either lost or delivered to wrong residences. The items are marked as delivered and no one is able to tell me what happened or where my money has gone. I'm done! I'll go back to the old school way of going into a store, paying a little more, and leaving with my purchase in hand.

Before using this app, i was not an amazon prime member. After finishing adding my items to my cart in the app, i proceeded to checkout. I arrived at a screen that had two options: sign up with prime today in a yellow button or continue without prime in blue. I selected the second option but the app did not respond or proceed. I tried this multiple times, going back and returning to this same screen and still unable to proceed. I finally pressed the first option which put me at the confirmation screen where all my items had prime shipping options. I immediately went on the website to deactivate prime but the prime items and shipping options remained. I talked to a representative from Amazon, Rasmi, who was unable to deactivate the prime and said i was stuck with it for the rest of the month and would lose free trial options. All this took place within the span of 30 minutes and i hadn't even finished my order. I am very disappointed in the app, this seems like a deceptive practice to force customers to sign up for prime

Amazon is the first place I go to search for any item I need because I know that most likely they're going to have the cheapest price, and if you don't want it knew you can also find your item used. And don't forget about all the extra features like Amazon Fire TV and everything like that! This is an amazing app that anybody should have and for an extra hundred bucks a year you get free 2-day shipping on everything you order plus free TV free movies and even have your groceries delivered. This is an all-around app, if you're living in 2018 and forward you got to have it.

Have been a loyal Amazon Prime member and frequent shopper for years. The service isn't at all what it used to be though. What happened to free 2 day shipping for Prime members? Now orders are being split up into individual items, each with their own shipping speed, and something that used to get here in 2 days without issue will now take a week. It's madness. It seems they want you to pay more more more and give you less less less. Honestly, at this point I am mostly using Walmart for everything I used to get through Amazon. Their prices and shipping are both consistent. Amazon can not beat out the competition anymore. Seems like they stopped caring about quality customer service over this past year. Not sure I will continue with Prime when it comes time to renew. Shopping Amazon isn't as fun and rewarding an experience as it used to be.

I love Amazon, and I used to love this app, but in the last month or so they have made changes that make it very user unfriendly! The add to cart button doesn't work, the search history doesn't work, hell most of the time I can't even get the app to load. That's a lot of money that Amazon is loosing from me. I used to pretty much do all my shopping there, now I go elsewhere. Probably going to cancel my Prime membership.

I can't click on tabs (my basketã€my accountã€ search)ã€its like the app is frozen but I'm able to scroll on the current page fine. If I don't completely shut down the app and try to use the app again later I continuously get "oops page not found" errors. I find myself having to completely restart the app every few hours. For a big company like Amazon their app on android should be as efficient as apple. This is ridiculous

This app use to work perfectly fine but now every time I click on something to look at it in a closer view from the search bar the screen changes from the item and says "oops something went wrong on our end." This happens EVERY single time I click on an item I wish to look at. The app has been updated to recent update as well.

Love using it but it does feel like an outdated app looks wise. It doesn't support notches (I have a pixel 3xl) so there's just a black bar at the top, plus there's a lot of weird animations that don't really flow together. Would be awesome if they gave it a matireal theme overhaul but, since it's Amazon, we may never see that.

First off I am very happy with my deliveries, usually come sooner than expected. When I am scrolling through items and click on an item that I want to view it pops up like it should, but when I click back it puts me in a different spot. Sometimes all the way back to the beginning. That's frustrating. But my biggest complaint is I am unable to get ahold of customer support. It keeps saying the call back service is unavailable at this time.

Completely Broken This app is great until I try to buy something. Even though I am logged in, upon clicking proceed to checkout from the cart screen I get a device cannot be authenticated error message and my cart is erased. I have tried rolling back and reinstalling the update to no avail. A shopping app is useless if it won't allow one to make a purchase. Fix it and I will change my rating.

Amazon itself is phenomenal. If I have an issue with an order or something I bought, they work quickly to resolve my problem. Through the app I have been easily able to reach a live support rep through chat or phone. My problem is with the redesigned home page. No more "pick up where you left off." No more "recently viewed." Now it's just items they think you might like, or items that just happen to be on sale. This is a step backwards. It's been this way since a few updates ago, I think. I don't like it and I don't think it's useful. The home screen needs to be redesigned back to the way it was.

When you search for prime items, non prime items are mixed in with the results. Delivery date changes after order is placed to a later date. Amazons delivery service has degraded since relying on the USPS. You're hard pressed to ever get Prime two-day delivery anymore. Also USPS lies about attempted deliveries. They do not leave a pink re-delivery slip, which tells you they did not attempt a delivery. They lie on the report so when you contact Amazon, they will tell you they tried but no one was home and there was no safe place to leave the package, then the next day or two it shows up left by the front door. Mysteriously, the security of my front porch changed. Seeing that more and more Prime items are higher priced than non prime items, Prime is no longer worth the money.

Having troubles with AmazonSmile trial! I prefer using amazonsmile, and for that tend to defer from the app when making my final purchase. But recently when I open the app it indicates that as a trial I can use amazonsmile if I turn on the notifications, and even though all notifications are turned on in the app, it still thinks they are not. I would very much appreciate this feature being fixed.

The app is good and all, but I have to delete it just to log out. Everywhere I look says to go to menu>your acoount>log out but the option does not even exist. I've searched the entirety of the settings about 3 times and came up with nothing. Other people who experienced the same problem, and posted on answer forums not related to amazon, were also told to go to the account menu (as if we didn't already check there first). I would just really appreciate the ability to log out without going the through the hassle of reinstalling.

THIEVES! I ordered an item a month ago on sale for $203. The item was in stock for weeks, still no delivery notice. I called cust service who seemed helpful, they apologized for the inconvenience, offered 1 day shipping & a $5 credit. When I hung up I got a message stating the order was canceled. Went through the app to chat with cust service. They told me to order again @ full price & they would adjust it & transferred me 8 times & they all refused to return the $75 I was tricked into spending.

Too glitchy. In the shopping/wish lists, when I'm browsing for a specific list i.e. babies or groceries, it will suddenly glitch and switch to another list so my stuff either goes on the wrong thing or it doesn't go on at all! And there is no item limit warning for the lists. It will just delete stuff off until it's back under the item limit!

This is a great app except for one thing... There needs to be more options for notifications. Currently it sends notifications when an item ships, tells me when it will arrive the next day, and let's me know that it's been delivered. I order quite a few items, and they are mostly prime so I know when to expect them. I live on property and packages are left in a box outside the gate, so I like getting the notifications that something has been delivered so I know to go get it. But I'm mostly annoyed by the other notifications. I don't care that it's been shipped and I already know it will be here tomorrow. Unfortunately there is currently no way that I can find to separate out just the notifications I want. It's all three or not at all. I would give the app 5 stars if it had that option.

This app is much faster than the old Amazon app. However, Amazon deliberately groups all notifications, including package delivery and advertisements, into a single notification category. Then, they disable unrelated features of the app, such as AmazonSmile, to try to get you to turn notifications back on.

I am really unhappy with what seems to be a new delivery system. I have always received my order via USPS, FedEx, or UPS. I just recently started receiving from what seems like independent deliverers. I have not had good experiences with these independent deliverers. I don't want to order anything anymore because I usually have an issue with the delivery. I don't think I will use Amazon for my shopping if this keeps up. I am really disappointed in this way of delivering. I have always enjoyed shopping with Amazon but will not continue with the way it is going ðŸ˜”

The application does not work at all on my phone (Kyrocero Brigadier). Will display the home screen for a moment, then an error message. Same thing when trying to create an account, error message. Tried a dozen times. Now I remember why I uninstalled it the first time. Everything works fine on my Kindle...

I bought an exclusive item in a pre-sale, and not only did Amazon lose my item they took no responsibility for it and didn't even notify me about it. Thank God I thought to check. What am I paying that prime membership fee for? They should definitely have something in place to cover their own incompetence. The LAST thing I'm ordering from this app. Terrible!

It's very glitchy. Some pages take forever to download and I often get "oops!" errors where the page just crashes. It's not easy to shop either because it doesn't show enough titles for items, so you have to rely on the thumbnail pic to determine what you're looking for.

Majority of users have subscribed to prime services, which guarantees two day shipping. Initially, this was great and items were received well within the promised time frames. However, lately it's more like a 4 or 5 day turnaround. When I speak to customer service, they blame it on logistics. I understand situations come up with shippers, that you have no control over. However, there is no communication with the purchaser about their items being delayed. I've had 3 separate orders in the last month, that have not been delivered within the 2 day window. Quite simply put, if you cant back up the guarantees you offer, then you shouldnt advertise them.

I have been a prime member since the beginning. All their applications have gotten terrible. Their customer service is horrible. Can I get one person that speaks english clearly? From my experience no. Even explaining simple issues is impossible. Their English comprehension just isn't adequate enough for problem solving. I get out for delivery notifications and nothing comes then they send me out for delivery notifications 10 days later for the same items. Call in to ask about what is going on and the answer is always "I don't know". Well I will spend my money somewhere else. All services are canceled.

It's way easier to order via the website and I'm not sure the point of the app or the benefit this app provides. It's much harder to login in to, and when searching on the web it sometimes doesnt link or get to the correct page after clicking on an amazon link. Overall, not really much of a point to this app. Just buy it on the website.

For the last few months or so the app has just been getting worse. It used to be great, now it just crashes or sits idle and not responding whilst sat on a blank screen, this needs fixing as it's currently unusable. I have had no such issues with other apps and have updated the app, but this still happens.

Many of the reviews I read were specifically about Amazon, rather than the app. I find the App easy to navigate, use, and order from. No issues regarding the App. Amazon itself, also no complaints. careful on clothes orders from other countries!! But really, no problems.

The app isn't bad, just Amazon. Purchased 4 items, returned 1 due to being listed wrong (refunded). Try to return another due to an in correct answer to a question. When I tried to return it, they said to destroy the item and we will refund you. They refunded me the incorrect item. When I tried to fix this, they wanted proof of the the again destroyed item, it was already thrown away. Had to argue with them about getting the difference refunded back. They eventually gave me the full refund back for the item. 2 orders, 2 problems, never ordering from this site again. eBay is easier to deal with.

With the latest update the app signs me up for Amazon Prime automatically every time I open the app..regardless of which account is logged in. Also I recieve on average over 10 sales notifications a day. When I block app notifications they get turned back on with each update. It has become Nagware. Uninstall/reinstall doesnt fix the problem. Amazon Customer Service is unable/unwilling to help. Had to uninstall and shop via browser.

What are y'all doing? I get a notification from the other amazon app that support for it will end soon and to switch to this one so I download it. it seems good and I go through "geeky finds" and every item I click on takes me back to home page even on other lists. That does not do me any good. The regular app works better. Thankfully the rest of the app seems to work the same.

Awesome app. If you use Amazon often, this app is for you. If you use the app alot, I would suggest also buying the Prime membership. You get a free music service(similar to Spotify) , a free movie/TV show service(similar to Netflix, and cheaper) , discounts on some items, 2 day delivery, and often, free delivery. It's about $100 for a year, but it's easily worth more.

I have an Amazon Prime Account. I get most of the gifts I buy for people, my preschool classroom decorations, unique stuff that I just love and tons of other stuff from Amazon. I shop more on Amazon than anywhere else! I have found some of the most beautiful and amazing stuff on this app! With the prime account I get my stuff in just a couple of days.
